title: Circuit de Spa-Francorchamps
summary: The Circuit de Spa-Francorchamps (French pronunciation: ​[siʁkɥi də spa fʁɑ̃kɔʁʃɑ̃]), frequently referred to as Spa,[1][2] is a motor-racing circuit located in Stavelot, Belgium. It is the current venue of the Formula One Belgian Grand Prix, hosting its first Grand Prix in 1925, and has held a Grand Prix every year since 1985 (except 2003 and 2006).
